00055 /* temporary buffer for the high byte, to avoid that
00056  * the ringbuffer contains a value, where high-byte and low byte
00057  * belong to two different samples (16bit write should be atomic) */
00058 uint8_t highbyte_temp;
00059 
00060 /** The SPI interrupt service routine. This
00061  * route is called everytime, a byte has been completly 
00062  * transmitted over the SPI-Interface. According to the current state
00063  * of the transmission, either the low-byte of the 16bit word has to be
00064  * send, or a new transfer needs to be started
00065  */
00066 SIGNAL( SIG_SPI )
00067 {       
00068         cli(); /* disable any interrupt */
00069          switch ( gyro_state )
00070          {
00071                 case (first_run): /* first entry of isr */
00072                         gyro1_idx = 0; /* set ringbuffer-idice to 0 */
00073                         gyro2_idx = 0;
00074                         PORTD = PORTD & 0xCF; /* clear both CS-lines, CS0 */
00075                         PORTB = PORTB & 0xFE; /* activate /CS */
00076                         SPDR = ACC_HB; /* transmit high byte of read-accl. cmd */
00077                         gyro_state = g1_hacc;
00078                 break;
00079                 case (g1_hacc):
00080                         highbyte_temp = SPDR; /* read in high-byte of accl-value */
00081                         if(highbyte_temp & 0x08)
00082                                 highbyte_temp |= 0xF0;
00083                         else 
00084                                 highbyte_temp &= 0x0F;
00085                         SPDR = ACC_LB; /* transmit low-byte of read-accl. cmd */
00086                         gyro_state = g1_lacc;
00087                 break;
00088                 case (g1_lacc):
00089                         PORTB = PORTB | 0x01; /* deactivate /CS */
00090                         gyro1_samples[ gyro1_idx ] = (uint16_t)((highbyte_temp<<8) | SPDR) ; /* save accl-value */
00091                         gyro1_idx =  (gyro1_idx+1) & (GYRO1_SAMPLES_BUFSIZE-1); /* increase index to ringbuffer */
00092                         #ifndef READ_GYRO1_ONLY
00093                         PORTD = PORTD | (CS_GYRO2 << 4); /* switch CS to Gyro2 */
00094                         #endif
00095                         PORTB = PORTB & 0xFE; /* activate /CS */
00096                         SPDR = ACC_HB; /* send high-byte to Gyro 2 */
00097                         #ifndef READ_GYRO1_ONLY
00098                         gyro_state = g2_hacc;
00099                         #else
00100                         gyro_state = g1_hacc;
00101                         #endif
00102                 break;
00103                 case (g2_hacc):
00104                         highbyte_temp = SPDR; /* save high byte of Gyro 2 */
00105                         if(highbyte_temp & 0x08)
00106                                 highbyte_temp |= 0xF0;
00107                         else 
00108                                 highbyte_temp &= 0x0F;
00109                         SPDR = ACC_LB;
00110                         gyro_state = g2_lacc;
00111                 break;
00112                 case (g2_lacc):
00113                         PORTB = PORTB | 0x01; /* deactivate /CS */
00114                         gyro2_samples[ gyro2_idx ] =  (uint16_t)((highbyte_temp << 8 ) | SPDR); /* save low-byte of Gyro 2 */
00115                         gyro2_idx =  (gyro2_idx+1) & (GYRO2_SAMPLES_BUFSIZE-1);
00116                         PORTD = PORTD & 0xCF; /* switch CS to Gyro1 */
00117                         PORTB = PORTB & 0xFE; /* activate /CS */
00118                         /*
00119                          *  when the temperature-read-flag is set, the FSM forks at this point and
00120                          *  reads both temperatures before returning to normal (read accleration) operation
00121                          */                     
00122                         if( !read_gyro_temp ) /* check if the temperature shall be read */
00123                         {
00124                                 /* don't read temperature */
00125                                 SPDR = ACC_HB; /* transmit high byte of "get accl." */
00126                                 gyro_state = g1_hacc;
00127                         }
00128                         else
00129                         {
00130                                 /* read temperature */ 
00131                                 SPDR = TEMP_HB; /* transmit high byte of "get temp." */
00132                                 gyro_state = g1_htmp;
00133                         }
00134                 break;
00135                 /* 
00136                  *  the following states are for reading the temperature values and
00137                  *  get skipped in normal operation 
00138                  * */
00139                 case g1_htmp:
00140                         highbyte_temp = SPDR;
00141                         SPDR = TEMP_LB;
00142                         gyro_state = g1_ltmp;
00143                 break;
00144                 case g1_ltmp:
00145                         PORTB = PORTB | 0x01; /* deactivate /CS */
00146                         gyro1_temp = (uint16_t)((highbyte_temp << 8 ) | SPDR); /* save temp. to global variable */
00147                         PORTD = PORTD | (CS_GYRO2 << 4); /* switch CS to Gyro2 */
00148                         PORTB = PORTB & 0xFE; /* activate /CS */
00149                         SPDR = TEMP_HB; /* send  "read temp" high-byte to Gyro 2 */
00150                         gyro_state = g2_htmp;
00151                 case g2_htmp:
00152                         highbyte_temp = SPDR;
00153                         SPDR = TEMP_LB;
00154                         gyro_state = g2_ltmp;
00155                 break;
00156                 case g2_ltmp:
00157                         PORTB = PORTB | 0x01; /* deactivate /CS */
00158                         gyro2_temp = (uint16_t)((highbyte_temp << 8 ) | SPDR); /* save temp. to global variable */
00159                         read_gyro_temp = 0; /* clear the flag indicating that the temperature shall be read */
00160                         /* now reading both temperature is finished and the FSM goes back to its normal mode of operation */
00161                         PORTD = PORTD & 0xCF; /* switch CS to Gyro1 */
00162                         PORTB = PORTB & 0xFE; /* activate /CS */
00163                         SPDR = ACC_HB; /* send  "read accl" high-byte to Gyro 1 */
00164                         gyro_state = g1_hacc;
00165                 break; 
00166                 default: /* this should never happen */
00167                         gyro_state = first_run; 
00168                 break;
00169          }
00170          sei();/* enable interrupts */
00171 }

00174 /** Initialize the onboard SPInterface to match the needs
00175  * of the AD ADIS16100 Gyroskope. This means setting the clock,
00176  * setting the ports directions, setting mode etc.
00177  * @param interrupt_mode flag wether to enable the interrupt mode
00178  *                      in irq-mode, the ISR takes care of reading the Gyros
00179  *                      as fast as possible and fills a global array used as 
00180  *                      ringbuffer of sample-values. Either the Gyros have
00181  *                      to be read manually by calling the spi_write-functions.
00182  */
00183  void init_spi_gyro( uint8_t interrupt_mode)
00184  {
00185         
00186         uint8_t ie;
00187         
00188         if( 1==interrupt_mode)
00189         {
00190                 ie = 1;
00191         }
00192         else
00193                 ie = 0;
00194                 
00195         /** Set the SPI-port-Pin directions:
00196          * B0 - /SS -> Output, 1
00197          * B1 - SCLK -> Output, 1
00198          * B2 - MOSI -> Output, 1
00199          * B3 - MISO -> Input, 0
00200         */
00201         DDRB = DDRB & 0xF0; /* clear SPI-Pins */
00202         DDRB = DDRB | 0x07; /* set SPI-Direction Pins 0111b (MISO input, SCLK, MOSI, SS output) */
00203         
00204         /* set the CS1 and CS2 signals on Port D to act as output */
00205         DDRD = DDRD | (1<<4) | (1<<5);
00206         /* set CS1 = 0 and CS2 = 0 -> activate Chipsel 1 */
00207     PORTD = PORTD & 0xCF;
00208         /* Set /SS to high -> inactive */
00209         PORTB = PORTB | 0x01;  
00210         
00211         /** Set SPI Control register:
00212          * 7 - SPIE, Interrup Enable -> 1, enable IRQs
00213          * 6 - SPE, SPI-Enbale -> 1, enable SPI-System
00214          * 5 - DORD, DataOrder -> 0, MSB first (leftshift)
00215          * 4 - MSTR, Master/Slave ->  1, MasterMode
00216          * 3 - CPOL, ClkPolarity -> 0, begin with leading edge rising,trailing edge falling
00217          * 2 - CPHA, ClkPhase -> 1, sample on leading edge (0-1), setup on trailing(1-0)
00218          * 1,0 SPR1,0, ClockRate, 1,1 - for 125 kHz CLK with SPI2x not set       */
00219          SPCR = 0x00 | (ie<<SPIE) | (1<<SPE) | (1<<MSTR) | (1<<CPHA) | (1<<SPR1) | (0<<SPR0); /* 0b1101 0100 */
00220          
00221          /** Set SPI  Status Register:
00222           * 0, SPI2X -> 1,clk-doubling for 0.25 Mhz  */
00223           SPSR = 0x00 | (0<<SPI2X);
00224           
00225           /** Set the selftest-signals to be outputs */
00226           DDRA = DDRA | (1<<PA5) | (1<<PA6);
00227           
00228           /** deactive self-tests */
00229           PORTA = PORTA & ~( (1<<PA5) | (1<<PA6)) ;
00230           
00231           if( 1==interrupt_mode )
00232                 SPDR = 0x00; /* start first transmission, rest is handled by ISR */
00233  }

00235  /** choose a chip by setting the CS1 and CS2 signal
00236   * towards the GAL according
00237   * @param chip Nr of the /CS-Signal to choose (0-3)
00238   */
00239  void spi_cs( uint8_t chip )
00240  {
00241                 /* clear CS1 and CS2 */
00242                 PORTD = PORTD & 0xCF;
00243                 PORTD = PORTD |  ((chip & 0x03)<<4);
00244                 return;
00245  }

00247   /* Transfer 1 Byte given in data via the SPI,
00248   * return the 1 Byte sampled during transfer.
00249   * @param data 8bit word that is transferred
00250   * @return data sampled during transfer
00251   */  
00252  uint8_t spi_write_8( uint8_t data )
00253  {
00254                 uint8_t indata=0;
00255                 /* activate chipselect (/SS) for SPI: */
00256                 PORTB = PORTB & 0xFE; /* clear lowest bit */
00257                 /* send high byte of output */
00258                 SPDR = data;
00259                 /* wait for transfer to finish (IRQ-Flag set) 
00260                  * the flag is clear automatically by reading the
00261                  * status register and then the data-register, 
00262                  * see datasheet 10/06, p. 170 */
00263                 while( !(SPSR & (1<<SPIF)) )
00264                         ;
00265                 /* save the high byte of input */
00266                 indata = SPDR;
00267                 PORTB = PORTB | 0x01; /* deactivate /SS, set lowest bit */
00268                 return indata; 
00269  }

00272   * Returns the 1 Byte sampled during transfer.
00273   * DOES NOT switch CS
00274   * @param data 8bit word that is transferred
00275   * @return data sampled during transfer
00276   */  
00277  uint8_t spi_write_8_nocs( uint8_t data )
00278  {
00279                 uint8_t indata=0;
00280                 /* send high byte of output */
00281                 SPDR = data;
00282                 /* wait for transfer to finish (IRQ-Flag set) 
00283                  * the flag is clear automatically by reading the
00284                  * status register and then the data-register, 
00285                  * see datasheet 10/06, p. 170 */
00286                 while( !(SPSR & (1<<SPIF)) )
00287                         ;
00288                 /* save the high byte of input */
00289                 indata = SPDR;
00290                 return indata; 
00291  }

00293  /* Tranfer 2 Bytes given in data via the SPI,
00294   * return the 2 Bytes sampled during transfer.
00295   * @param data 16bit word that is transferred
00296   * @return data sampled during transfer
00297   */  
00298  uint16_t spi_write_16( uint16_t data )
00299  {
00300                 uint16_t indata=0;
00301                 /* activate chipselect (/SS) for SPI: */
00302                 PORTB = PORTB & 0xFE; /* clear lowest bit */
00303                 /* send high byte of output */
00304                 SPDR = (uint8_t) ((data & 0xFF00)>>8); 
00305                 /* wait for transfer to finish (IRQ-Flag set) 
00306                  * the flag is clear automatically by reading the
00307                  * status register and then the data-register, 
00308                  * see datasheet 10/06, p. 170 */
00309                 while( !(SPSR & (1<<SPIF)) )
00310                         ;
00311                 /* save the high byte of input */
00312                 indata = (uint16_t) (SPDR << 8 );
00313                 /* send low-byte of output */
00314                 SPDR = (uint8_t) (data & 0x00FF );
00315                 while( !(SPSR & (1<<SPIF)) )
00316                         ;
00317                 indata = indata | SPDR ;
00318                 PORTB = PORTB | 0x01; /* deactivate /SS, set lowest bit */
00319                 return indata; 
00320 }
